title: Good Arguments
author: Bo Seo
notes: A beautiful exploration of debate and disagreement. Changed how I think about arguments — not as battles to win, but as collaborative searches for truth.

title: Devoción
author: Williamsburg, NYC
notes: My favorite spot to work. Colombian coffee, incredible space with a living wall, and just the right amount of bustle. I've written so much here.

title: Sunday mornings
notes: Slow coffee, no plans, nowhere to be. The city is quiet. These mornings keep me sane.

title: The Almanack of Naval Ravikant
author: Eric Jorgenson
notes: Wealth, happiness, and the importance of leverage. Naval's ideas on specific knowledge and accountability have shaped how I think about career decisions.

title: How to Do Great Work
author: Paul Graham
notes: The importance of curiosity and working on things that excite you. Keep returning to this when I feel stuck.

title: Russ & Daughters
author: Lower East Side, NYC
notes: The best bagels in the city. Been coming here since I moved to New York. It feels like history.

title: Designing Data-Intensive Applications
author: Martin Kleppmann
notes: The bible for distributed systems. Dense but incredibly valuable for understanding how modern data systems work.
